```{r functions, echo = FALSE}
# Takes a poll data file from FiveThirtyEight and cleans it up

get_poll_data <- function(poll_file) {
  read_csv(poll_file) %>% 
    clean_names() %>%
    select(-race, -timestamp) %>% 
    rename(c(name = "candidate_name",
             date = "modeldate",
             poll_estimate = "pct_estimate",
             poll_trend_adjusted = "pct_trend_adjusted",
             contest_date = "contestdate")) %>% 
    mutate(date = as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%Y"),
           contest_date = as.Date(contest_date, "%m/%d/%Y"),
           poll_estimate = poll_estimate * .01,
           poll_trend_adjusted = round(poll_trend_adjusted * .01, 4),
           name = str_replace_all(name, pattern = c(
             "Bernard Sanders" = "Bernie Sanders",
             "Joseph R\\. Biden Jr\\." = "Joe Biden"
           )))
}

# Takes market data from PredictIt and cleans it up

add_market_data <- function(market_file, state_name, date_of_contest) {
  read_csv(market_file) %>% 
    rename(c(name = "ContractName",
             date = "Date",
              market_close = "CloseSharePrice", 
              market_volume = "TradeVolume")) %>% 
    select(name, date, market_close, market_volume) %>%
    mutate(date = as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%Y"),
           market_close = str_replace_all(market_close, 
                                          pattern = c("\\$" = "")),
           market_close = as.numeric(as.character(market_close)),
           market_volume = as.numeric(market_volume),
           name = str_replace_all(name, pattern = c(
             "Sanders" = "Bernie Sanders",
             "Biden" = "Joe Biden",
             "Warren" = "Elizabeth Warren",
             "Buttigieg" = "Pete Buttigieg",
             "Klobuchar" = "Amy Klobuchar",
             "Gabbard" = "Tulsi Gabbard",
             "Bloomberg" = "Michael Bloomberg",
             "Yang" = "Andrew Yang",
             "Patrick" = "Deval Patrick"
           )),
           state = state_name) %>% 
    full_join(dem_primary, by = c(date = "date", name = "name", state = "state")) %>% 
    {if ("market_close.x" %in% colnames(.)) 
      mutate(., market_close = ifelse(!is.na(market_close.x), 
                               market_close.x, 
                               market_close.y),
             market_volume = ifelse(!is.na(market_volume.x), 
                                market_volume.x, 
                                market_volume.y)) 
      else .} %>% 
  select(state, contest_date, name, date, market_close, market_volume, poll_estimate, poll_trend_adjusted)
}

# Creates new tibble with just the market price and poll data from the day
# before the election, along with the final results of the election. Also
# creates a ranking based on each of those variables.


final_results <- function(link, num_candidates, state_name, num_col = 4, nodes = ".e-name-display , .e-percent-val , .e-votes-display, .e-del-display") {
  results_data <- read_html(link) %>% 
    html_nodes(nodes) %>%
    html_text() %>%
    matrix(nrow = num_candidates, ncol = num_col, byrow = TRUE) %>% 
    as.data.frame() %>% 
    rename(c(name = "V1",
             votes = "V2",
             vote_percent = "V3")) %>%
    mutate(state = state_name,
           name = as.character(name),
           name = str_remove(name, pattern = "\n"),
           name = trimws(name, which = c("both")),
           name = str_replace_all(name, 
                                  pattern = c("Joseph R\\. Biden Jr\\." = "Joe Biden",
                                              "Michael R\\. Bloomberg" = "Michael Bloomberg")),
           final_rank = 1:num_candidates,
           votes = str_remove(votes, pattern = "\\,"),
           vote_percent = as.numeric(as.character(vote_percent)) * .01) %>% 
    filter(name != "Others", name != "Uncommitted")
  
  dem_primary %>%
    filter(state == state_name,
           date == contest_date - 1) %>% 
    left_join(results_data, by = c(name = "name", state = "state")) %>% 
    filter(vote_percent > 0) %>% 
    select(state, name, vote_percent, market_close, poll_estimate, poll_trend_adjusted, final_rank, contest_date, date_dropped) %>% 
    rbind(final_results_data)
}


```
